I just finished drafting a short memo providing some of the missing context from the meeting https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ck_8fZWnd6uxTksQFMhsvHF-GfaQpVXx67U9QNKd4h0

content.body: mpcsh: thanks for putting it together!

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: mpcsh: thanks for putting it together!

content.body: I have a couple of minor suggestions for phrasing
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I have a couple of minor suggestions for phrasing

content.body: "we determined that Nonviolent Communication Training (NVC) is the best way to directly solve this problem." -> maybe "We believe that..."? I'm a bit paranoid about leaving the impression that we think the training is a one-stop solution that never has to be considered in the future
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: "we determined that Nonviolent Communication Training (NVC) is the best way to directly solve this problem." -> maybe "We believe that..."? I'm a bit paranoid about leaving the impression that we think the training is a one-stop solution that never has to be considered in the future

content.body: re. the last paragraph - I do think we should include something like this, making sure it's clear that we are not just talking about a few people who "couldn't handle pressure" or something like that, but it currently reads a bit on the defensive side. I'm not sure what the best way to rephrase it is
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: re. the last paragraph - I do think we should include something like this, making sure it's clear that we are not just talking about a few people who "couldn't handle pressure" or something like that, but it currently reads a bit on the defensive side. I'm not sure what the best way to rephrase it is

I like this, thank you
